First, I need to recall what I know about algae and plants. From what I remember, plants have a chloroplast, which contains a DNA molecule that provides instructions for photosynthesis. They also have a rigid cell wall made of cellulose, which gives them structural support. Their cells are arranged into layers called tissues, like roots, stems, and leaves, which allow them to move and organize themselves in the environment. On the other hand, algae are microscopic single-celled organisms. They don't have the same kind of structural organization as plants because they're so small. Instead, their entire body is composed of a single layer of cells. This means they can't differentiate between parts like roots, stems, or leaves; it's all part of the same organism. Additionally, their cell walls are usually chitin instead of cellulose, but since alga are too tiny, they don't develop such a thick wall yet. Looking at the options: A. Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: Algae may be microscopic single-celled organisms or enormousmulticellularseaweeds hundreds of feet long. The body of one of these organisms is termed athallus. How does athallusdiffer from a plant body?

A. A plant body shows differentiation of parts, with its roots, stems, and leaves all varying greatly in structure and in function. Multicellular algae show very little, if any, tissue differentiation.

B. Algae have a more complex structure than plants

C. A thallus has a rigid cell wall made of cellulose, which is absent in plant cells

D. A thallus consists of a single layer of cells, unlike the multilayered tissues of plants

E. Algae possess true flowers and seeds, which differentiates them from plants

F. Algae cells are much smaller than plant cells

G. Algae have vascular systems similar to plants for transporting nutrients

H. Algae bodies are typically organized into root-like, stem-like, and leaf-like structures

I. Algae are capable of photosynthesis while plants are not

J. Algae perform cellular respiration, while plants only perform photosynthesis

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: Algae may be microscopic single-celled organisms or enormousmulticellularseaweeds hundreds of feet long. The body of one of these organisms is termed athallus. How does athallusdiffer from a plant body?

A. A plant body shows differentiation of parts, with its roots, stems, and leaves all varying greatly in structure and in function. Multicellular algae show very little, if any, tissue differentiation.

B. Algae have a more complex structure than plants

C. A thallus has a rigid cell wall made of cellulose, which is absent in plant cells

D. A thallus consists of a single layer of cells, unlike the multilayered tissues of plants

E. Algae possess true flowers and seeds, which differentiates them from plants

F. Algae cells are much smaller than plant cells

G. Algae have vascular systems similar to plants for transporting nutrients

H. Algae bodies are typically organized into root-like, stem-like, and leaf-like structures

I. Algae are capable of photosynthesis while plants are not

J. Algae perform cellular respiration, while plants only perform photosynthesis

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: Algae may be microscopic single-celled organisms or enormousmulticellularseaweeds hundreds of feet long. The body of one of these organisms is termed athallus. How does athallusdiffer from a plant body?

A. A plant body shows differentiation of parts, with its roots, stems, and leaves all varying greatly in structure and in function. Multicellular algae show very little, if any, tissue differentiation.

B. Algae have a more complex structure than plants

C. A thallus has a rigid cell wall made of cellulose, which is absent in plant cells

D. A thallus consists of a single layer of cells, unlike the multilayered tissues of plants

E. Algae possess true flowers and seeds, which differentiates them from plants

F. Algae cells are much smaller than plant cells

G. Algae have vascular systems similar to plants for transporting nutrients

H. Algae bodies are typically organized into root-like, stem-like, and leaf-like structures

I. Algae are capable of photosynthesis while plants are not

J. Algae perform cellular respiration, while plants only perform photosynthesis

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: Algae may be microscopic single-celled organisms or enormousmulticellularseaweeds hundreds of feet long. The body of one of these organisms is termed athallus. How does athallusdiffer from a plant body?

A. A plant body shows differentiation of parts, with its roots, stems, and leaves all varying greatly in structure and in function. Multicellular algae show very little, if any, tissue differentiation.

B. Algae have a more complex structure than plants

C. A thallus has a rigid cell wall made of cellulose, which is absent in plant cells

D. A thallus consists of a single layer of cells, unlike the multilayered tissues of plants

E. Algae possess true flowers and seeds, which differentiates them from plants

F. Algae cells are much smaller than plant cells

G. Algae have vascular systems similar to plants for transporting nutrients

H. Algae bodies are typically organized into root-like, stem-like, and leaf-like structures

I. Algae are capable of photosynthesis while plants are not

J. Algae perform cellular respiration, while plants only perform photosynthesis

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

J. Algae perform cellular respiration, while plants only perform photosynthesis

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: Algae may be microscopic single-celled organisms or enormousmulticellularseaweeds hundreds of feet long. The body of one of these organisms is termed athallus. How does athallusdiffer from a plant body?

A. A plant body shows differentiation of parts, with its roots, stems, and leaves all varying greatly in structure and in function. Multicellular algae show very little, if any, tissue differentiation.

B. Algae have a more complex structure than plants

C. A thallus has a rigid cell wall made of cellulose, which is absent in plant cells

D. A thallus consists of a single layer of cells, unlike the multilayered tissues of plants

E. Algae possess true flowers and seeds, which differentiates them from plants

F. Algae cells are much smaller than plant cells

G. Algae have vascular systems similar to plants for transporting nutrients

H. Algae bodies are typically organized into root-like, stem-like, and leaf-like structures

I. Algae are capable of photosynthesis while plants are not

J. Algae perform cellular respiration, while plants only perform photosynthesis

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

C. A thallus has a rigid cell wall made of cellulose, which is absent in plant cells

F. Algae cells are much smaller than plant cells

G. Algae have vascular systems similar to plants for transporting nutrients

H. Algae bodies are typically organized into root-like, stem-like, and leaf-like structures

I. Algae are capable of photosynthesis while plants are not

J. Algae perform cellular respiration, while plants only perform photosynthesis

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: Algae may be microscopic single-celled organisms or enormousmulticellularseaweeds hundreds of feet long. The body of one of these organisms is termed athallus. How does athallusdiffer from a plant body?

A. A plant body shows differentiation of parts, with its roots, stems, and leaves all varying greatly in structure and in function. Multicellular algae show very little, if any, tissue differentiation.

B. Algae have a more complex structure than plants

C. A thallus has a rigid cell wall made of cellulose, which is absent in plant cells

D. A thallus consists of a single layer of cells, unlike the multilayered tissues of plants

E. Algae possess true flowers and seeds, which differentiates them from plants

F. Algae cells are much smaller than plant cells

G. Algae have vascular systems similar to plants for transporting nutrients

H. Algae bodies are typically organized into root-like, stem-like, and leaf-like structures

I. Algae are capable of photosynthesis while plants are not

J. Algae perform cellular respiration, while plants only perform photosynthesis

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: Algae may be microscopic single-celled organisms or enormousmulticellularseaweeds hundreds of feet long. The body of one of these organisms is termed athallus. How does athallusdiffer from a plant body?

A. A plant body shows differentiation of parts, with its roots, stems, and leaves all varying greatly in structure and in function. Multicellular algae show very little, if any, tissue differentiation.

B. Algae have a more complex structure than plants

C. A thallus has a rigid cell wall made of cellulose, which is absent in plant cells

D. A thallus consists of a single layer of cells, unlike the multilayered tissues of plants

E. Algae possess true flowers and seeds, which differentiates them from plants

F. Algae cells are much smaller than plant cells

G. Algae have vascular systems similar to plants for transporting nutrients

H. Algae bodies are typically organized into root-like, stem-like, and leaf-like structures

I. Algae are capable of photosynthesis while plants are not

J. Algae perform cellular respiration, while plants only perform photosynthesis

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: Algae may be microscopic single-celled organisms or enormousmulticellularseaweeds hundreds of feet long. The body of one of these organisms is termed athallus. How does athallusdiffer from a plant body?

A. A plant body shows differentiation of parts, with its roots, stems, and leaves all varying greatly in structure and in function. Multicellular algae show very little, if any, tissue differentiation.

B. Algae have a more complex structure than plants

C. A thallus has a rigid cell wall made of cellulose, which is absent in plant cells

D. A thallus consists of a single layer of cells, unlike the multilayered tissues of plants

E. Algae possess true flowers and seeds, which differentiates them from plants

F. Algae cells are much smaller than plant cells

G. Algae have vascular systems similar to plants for transporting nutrients

H. Algae bodies are typically organized into root-like, stem-like, and leaf-like structures

I. Algae are capable of photosynthesis while plants are not

J. Algae perform cellular respiration, while plants only perform photosynthesis

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: Algae may be microscopic single-celled organisms or enormousmulticellularseaweeds hundreds of feet long. The body of one of these organisms is termed athallus. How does athallusdiffer from a plant body?

A. A plant body shows differentiation of parts, with its roots, stems, and leaves all varying greatly in structure and in function. Multicellular algae show very little, if any, tissue differentiation.

B. Algae have a more complex structure than plants

C. A thallus has a rigid cell wall made of cellulose, which is absent in plant cells

D. A thallus consists of a single layer of cells, unlike the multilayered tissues of plants

E. Algae possess true flowers and seeds, which differentiates them from plants

F. Algae cells are much smaller than plant cells

G. Algae have vascular systems similar to plants for transporting nutrients

H. Algae bodies are typically organized into root-like, stem-like, and leaf-like structures

I. Algae are capable of photosynthesis while plants are not

J. Algae perform cellular respiration, while plants only perform photosynthesis

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: Algae may be microscopic single-celled organisms or enormousmulticellularseaweeds hundreds of feet long. The body of one of these organisms is termed athallus. How does athallusdiffer from a plant body?

A. A plant body shows differentiation of parts, with its roots, stems, and leaves all varying greatly in structure and in function. Multicellular algae show very little, if any, tissue differentiation.

B. Algae have a more complex structure than plants

C. A thallus has a rigid cell wall made of cellulose, which is absent in plant cells

D. A thallus consists of a single layer of cells, unlike the multilayered tissues of plants

E. Algae possess true flowers and seeds, which differentiates them from plants

F. Algae cells are much smaller than plant cells

G. Algae have vascular systems similar to plants for transporting nutrients

H. Algae bodies are typically organized into root-like, stem-like, and leaf-like structures

I. Algae are capable of photosynthesis while plants are not

J. Algae perform cellular respiration, while plants only perform photosynthesis

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: Algae may be microscopic single-celled organisms or enormousmulticellularseaweeds hundreds of feet long. The body of one of these organisms is termed athallus. How does athallusdiffer from a plant body?

C. A thallus has a rigid cell wall made of cellulose, which is absent in plant cells

F. Algae cells are much smaller than plant cells

G. Algae have vascular systems similar to plants for transporting nutrients

H. Algae bodies are typically organized into root-like, stem-like, and leaf-like structures

I. Algae are capable of photosynthesis while plants are not

J. Algae perform cellular respiration, while plants only perform photosynthesis

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: Algae may be microscopic single-celled organisms or enormousmulticellularseaweeds hundreds of feet long. The body of one of these organisms is termed athallus. How does athallusdiffer from a plant body?

A. A plant body shows differentiation of parts, with its roots, stems, and leaves all varying greatly in structure and in function. Multicellular algae show very little, if any, tissue differentiation.

B. Algae have a more complex structure than plants

C. A thallus has a rigid cell wall made of cellulose, which is absent in plant cells

D. A thallus consists of a single layer of cells, unlike the multilayered tissues of plants

E. Algae possess true flowers and seeds, which differentiates them from plants

F. Algae cells are much smaller than plant cells

G. Algae have vascular systems similar to plants for transporting nutrients

H. Algae bodies are typically organized into root-like, stem-like, and leaf-like structures

I. Algae are capable of photosynthesis while plants are not

J. Algae perform cellular respiration, while plants only perform photosynthesis

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

J. Algae perform cellular respiration, while plants only perform photosynthesis

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: Algae may be microscopic single-celled organisms or enormousmulticellularseaweeds hundreds of feet long. The body of one of these organisms is termed athallus. How does athallusdiffer from a plant body?

A. A plant body shows differentiation of parts, with its roots, stems, and leaves all varying greatly in structure and in function. Multicellular algae show very little, if any, tissue differentiation.

B. Algae have a more complex structure than plants

C. A thallus has a rigid cell wall made of cellulose, which is absent in plant cells

D. A thallus consists of a single layer of cells, unlike the multilayered tissues of plants

E. Algae possess true flowers and seeds, which differentiates them from plants

F. Algae cells are much smaller than plant cells

G. Algae have vascular systems similar to plants for transporting nutrients

H. Algae bodies are typically organized into root-like, stem-like, and leaf-like structures

I. Algae are capable of photosynthesis while plants are not

J. Algae perform cellular respiration, while plants only perform photosynthesis

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: Algae may be microscopic single-celled organisms or enormousmulticellularseaweeds hundreds of feet long. The body of one of these organisms is termed athallus. How does athallusdiffer from a plant body?

A. A plant body shows differentiation of parts, with its roots, stems, and leaves all varying greatly in structure and in function. Multicellular algae show very little, if any, tissue differentiation.

B. Algae have a more complex structure than plants

C. A thallus has a rigid cell wall made of cellulose, which is absent in plant cells

D. A thallus consists of a single layer of cells, unlike the multilayered tissues of plants

E. Algae possess true flowers and seeds, which differentiates them from plants

F. Algae cells are much smaller than plant cells

G. Algae have vascular systems similar to plants for transporting nutrients

H. Algae bodies are typically organized into root-like, stem-like, and leaf-like structures

I. Algae are capable of photosynthesis while plants are not

J. Algae perform cellular respiration, while plants only perform photosynthesis

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: Algae may be microscopic single-celled organisms or enormousmulticellularseaweeds hundreds of feet long. The body of one of these organisms is termed athallus. How does athallusdiffer from a plant body?

A. A plant body shows differentiation of parts, with its roots, stems, and leaves all varying greatly in structure and in function. Multicellular algae show very little, if any, tissue differentiation.

B. Algae have a more complex structure than plants

C. A thallus has a rigid cell wall made of cellulose, which is absent in plant cells

D. A thallus consists of a single layer of cells, unlike the multilayered tissues of plants

E. Algae possess true flowers and seeds, which differentiates them from plants

F. Algae cells are much smaller than plant cells

G. Algae have vascular systems similar to plants for transporting nutrients

H. Algae bodies are typically organized into root-like, stem-like, and leaf-like structures

I. Algae are capable of photosynthesis while plants are not

J. Algae perform cellular respiration, while plants only perform photosynthesis

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>
